metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3359 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel brcm_nvram_parse indrivers/nvmem/brcm_nvram.c. Lacks for the check of the return value ofkzalloc() can cause the NULL Pointer Dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3359` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-19.19').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-42.43~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1004.4').
